alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 11:08AM EST until December 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey...Pennsylvania... Delaware River At Easton-Phillipsburg affecting Hunterdon, Warren and Northampton Counties. For the Delaware River...including Easton-Phillipsburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Delaware River at Easton-Phillipsburg. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Backwater from the Delaware causes flooding in Easton along the Lehigh River At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins upstream in Harmony Station New Jersey and Sandts Eddy Pennsylvania. At 24.0 feet, Larry Holmes Drive in Easton is subject to flooding. Riverside Way in Phillipsburg is flooded in the area of the boat ramp. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 21.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 23.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.9 feet on 03/08/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Delaware River Easton-Phillips 22.0 21.9 Tue 10 a 17.5 13.6 23.3 7pm 12/19 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EST.
